alert.note: Alert for Ascension; East Baton Rouge; Iberville; Livingston (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 30 at 6:08PM CDT until March 30 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Ascension Parish in southeastern Louisiana... South Central East Baton Rouge Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Northeastern Iberville Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Northwestern Livingston Parish in southeastern Louisiana... * Until 800 PM CDT. * At 608 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Baton Rouge, Denham Springs, Oak Hills Place, Walker, Shenandoah, Old Jefferson, Inniswold, Westminster, Village St. George, Watson and Gardere. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 161 and 169. Interstate 12 between mile markers 2 and 18. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Ascension; East Baton Rouge; Iberville; Livingston
